results.title: The Rigid Heddle Frame
results.creator_credit: John Gray, Ken J. Widdowson and Educational Media
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Weaving”.
An instructional film on weaving for both beginners and more advanced weavers. In the rigid heddle frame, warp threads are passed through a slotted, wooden heddle instead of being attached to moving cords. Additional credits: photographer: Alan Grice ; script: Kay Donald ; editor: David Corke ; weaver and adviser: Erika Semler.

results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Robyn Cooney, Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, Michael Robertson Film Productions and New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.

results.title: Hockey one hockey two
results.brief_description: Former Australian International Hockey player Margaret Pierce demonstrates basic skills. In this film Margaret demonstrates the three types of dribbling in Hockey-close, loose and Indian. Aimed at the beginner to intermediate hockey students to improve their skills

results.title: [Remix: Historic Melbourne]
results.brief_description:
This video was created using footage from the ACMI Collection.

The remix features trams and historic landmarks in the City of Melbourne. Selected locations include the Princes Bridge, Flinders Street Station, corner of Spring and Bourke Street, intersection of Flinders and Swanston Street, ‘South Melb’ tram, Flinders Street Station Clocktower from Elizabeth Street, St Paul’s Cathedral, Forum Theatre, ‘Melbourne Public Library’ (State Library of Victoria) and the banks of the Yarra River.

results.title: [Remix: Summer beaches and pools]
results.brief_description: This remix of films from the ACMI Collection features footage of people sunbathing, playing at beaches during warm summers in Victoria. Notably, people are seen lounging around and diving into the Beaurepaire Pool, Melbourne’s first 50-metre Olympic-size swimming pool, formerly located on Batman Avenue.

results.title: [Remix: Victorian Road Signs]
results.brief_description:
Produced using footage from the ACMI Collection, this remix features painted road signs from locations all over Victoria, interspliced with shots of native wildlife and natural wilderness.

Road signs in order of appearance are: Halls Gap, Horsham, McKenzie Falls, Murray Valley Highway, Corryon, Walwa, Tumbarumba, Jingellic, Upper Kiewa Valley Road, Mt Beauty, Rocky Valley, Princes Highway, Gembrook, Cockatoo, Whitfield, Wangaratta, Ferntree Gully, Wilson’s Promontory National Park, Ovens River, Beechworth, San Remo, Porepunkah, Murray River, Anglesea and Great Ocean Road.

results.title: Jem Cohen: early works
results.brief_description: A rich and haunting collection of early works from an artist who paints with fragments of image and sound from New York street life. Dogs, passing cars, the homeless, drugged and alienated people drift through these works, in the rhythms of their own time. Simple mysteries are uncovered through a window, in half deserted streets, and in wind blown garbage. Voices become confessions, shadows become cinematic and we are absorbed and compiled into a world of wonder, in which people inevitably leave traces - and lists.

results.title: Video 50
results.creator_credit: Robert Wilson, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Boner and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Video 50 is an extraordinary video sketchbook, a highly original, visually dramatic and frequently humorous collection of one hundred abbreviated ‘episodes’ produced for television. Unfolding as a series of thirty-second vignettes, this enigmatic essay in style is characterized by a deadpan theatricality, symbolist imagery, surrealist juxtapositions and repetition of key visual motifs. Indelible images, precisely composed — a man teetering above a waterfall, a floating chair, a winking eye, a parrot against the New York skyline — are accompanied by an ‘architectural’ sound score that includes spoken ‘phonetic patterns’ rather than words. Fusing his surprising visual logic and rhythms with unexpected temporal manipulations, Wilson creates a work of startling wit and poetry.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Wilson, Caroline Arrighi, Robert Boner and Film and Video Collectif and Zweites Deutsches Fernsehen (ZDF)
